page.title: 03Transport Network Nantgarw
page.content: Nantgarw is surrounded by a transport network system which provides evidence of an important industrial area. The two dismantled railway lines that run to the north and south of the residential area of Nantgarw may be due to the decline in the mining industry. There is still, however, a mineral railway line running through the area. A comparatively small residential area, consisting of mainly council houses, is situated to the north of the mineral line. It appears to be purpose-built for employees of the nearby industrial estate. The main form of transport is now provided by the roads A4054; A468; and the A470(T) forming a link to the Cardiff, Merthyr Tydfil, Pontypridd, Newport and other valley areas.
